intro: Tessenia abruptorum, commonly known as the mountain tessenia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
